page.title: 06My family weekend
page.content: Saturday breakfast is casual - we eat piles of toast and discuss our programme for the day. Today it is fruit picking (Eleanor and I), piano lesson (Ginny), painting a door (Tony) and a dinner party (Tony and I). By 8 p.m. we have done everything except the dinner party. The children go to bed, our guests arrive, and Saturday slips into Sunday without our realising it. 9.15 a.m. on Sunday and we leave for church and Sunday school. By 10.45 we are back, and Tony lights the barbeque. We eat lunch and later go to Beauport for a swim. The girls do their homework reluctantly! There's an American film or a Handel concert on the television. Tony has some paperwork to do and I phone the parents (Sunday ritual). By ll p.m. we are in bed, the weekend is over.
